{"id":1027659566,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 months, 1 week","timestamp":1692625893,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"22 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1027659566/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"90.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    double findMedianSortedArrays(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {\n        int m = nums1.size();\n        int n = nums2.size();\n        int total = m + n;\n        int isEven = total % 2 == 0;\n\n        vector<int> ans;\n        int p1 = 0;\n        int p2 = 0;\n        while (p1 + p2 <= total / 2 && p1 < m && p2 < n) {\n            if (nums1[p1] < nums2[p2]) {\n                ans.push_back(nums1[p1]);\n                p1++;\n            } else {\n                ans.push_back(nums2[p2]);\n                p2++;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Append remaining elements from nums1 or nums2\n        while (p1 < m) {\n            ans.push_back(nums1[p1]);\n            p1++;\n        }\n        while (p2 < n) {\n            ans.push_back(nums2[p2]);\n            p2++;\n        }\n\n        if (isEven) {\n            return (ans[total / 2 - 1] + ans[total / 2]) / 2.0;\n        } else {\n            return ans[total / 2];\n        }\n    }\n};\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
